snippet: Microsoft is so determined to have lots of brand-name apps for its Windows Phone app store that it is willing to pay for them, Jenna Wortham and Nick Wingfield report in Friday's New York Times. Many developers are reluctant to put resources into an...
abstract: Microsoft is so determined to have lots of brand-name apps for its Windows Phone app store that it is willing to pay for them, Jenna Wortham and Nick Wingfield report in Friday's New York Times. Many developers are reluctant to put resources into an app for Microsoft's Windows Phone operating system, which is still a small market.

headline.main: Daily Report: Microsoft Pays for Big-Name Apps
